intro: Matelea monticola, commonly known as the mountain matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a soft, hairy texture. Matelea monticola is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
